questions.question: The turning point of a story is called the climax.  What happened at the climax of The Giver?

choices.answer: Something within Jonas told him to throw away his pill.
Jonas realized his father had killed a child during release.
Jonas recognized the childhood game was a game of war.
Jonas lied to his parents for the first time.

questions.question: In The Giver, the main conflict is between Jonas and--

choices.answer: nature
his society
the supernatural
the Chief Elder

questions.question: Most of the story takes place in a community where--

choices.answer: buildings were unique
magical creatures granted special powers to children
rules and rituals dominated residents lives
war with a nearby community had taken the lives of adults

questions.question: The Giver could be described as all EXCEPT--

choices.answer: a mystery, a story that unravels secrets
science fiction, a story based on real/imagined discoveries
autobiography, the story of a person's life by that person
fantasy, stories with strange/imaginary characters/setting

questions.question: At Asher's assignment, the Chief Elder made a joke-what is the mood of the story at this point?

choices.answer: humorous
calm
angry
fearful

questions.question: What is the theme or message of this story?

choices.answer: It's important for people to focus on the present not past
People must be allowed to choose in order to experience life
Nature and forces of nature can't be controlled by humankind
Physical, emotional, and spiritual health is important

questions.question: The character known as The Giver could best be described as a--

choices.answer: spiritual leader who had a devoted group of followers
a sly and crafty man motivated by self-interest and greed
wise elder who suffered pain/isolation as the Receiver
loyal member of the community who supported the Elders

questions.question: Which of the following lets the reader know the story took place in the future?

choices.answer: The search planes used heat-seeking devices
Benjamin had developed machines/methods for rehabilitation
Climate control was used to eliminate sunshine/snow/rain
A child's comfort object was taken away at eight years old

questions.question: Though Jonas was initially somewhat indifferent toward Gabriel, what did Gabriel symbolize?

choices.answer: hope and starting over
faith in a higher power
suffering and pain
fear of failure

questions.question: Jonas, Gabriel, and The Giver were alike in that they--

choices.answer: lacked self-control
had pale eyes
could not hear
suffered from insomnia

questions.question: How was Gabriel unlike Asher, Father, and Lily?

choices.answer: He developed more rapidly than other children
He successfully received the memories Jonas gave him
He had been born to a female who wasn't his birthmother
He had undergone a procedure to eliminate his nurturing

questions.question: After Jonas began training as The Receiver, he became more --

choices.answer: lonely and dissatisfied with the limitations of sameness
jealous of Asher and Benjamin's friendship
insecure and dependent on his family unit
fearful and mistrustful of The Giver

questions.question: When Jonas described the dream of his first Stirrings, the reader can conclude that Jonas--

choices.answer: did not respect Mother and Father
blamed Gabriel for disrupting the family unit
knew he had been chosen to be The Receiver
had romantic feelings for Fiona

questions.question: Why did Jonas lie when asked if he understood the inappropriateness of the word "love"?

choices.answer: Members of the committee were observing him
He realized that the feeling of love was unknown to them
He didn't want to confuse Lily who was listening
He knew his mother would report his lack of understanding

questions.question: What happened when the community performed a Ceremony of Loss?

choices.answer: The name of the lost person was murmured throughout the day
The individual was Released and placed into another person
Each citizen tossed a piece of wood onto a pyre
Family members cut their hair to show they were in mourning

questions.question: Why did Jonas flee the community at night?

choices.answer: He suspected The Giver had revealed their plan to the Elders
Asher had gone missing while patrolling the border
Gabriel was to be released the following morning
He received a message from Rosemary

questions.question: As a Receiver of Memory, Jonas was given permission to--

choices.answer: choose his own spouse
steal
apply for release
ask any question

questions.question: Jonas felt stunned and dizzy when---

choices.answer: Lily was removed from his family unit
he was pelted with stones while biking to the Annex
Fiona held his hand and revealed her feelings for him
the Chief Elder skipped him during the Ceremony of Twelve

questions.question: What did the Chief Elder say to each Twelve after announcing his or her Assignment?

choices.answer: "May the odds be always in your favor."
"Thank you for your childhood"
"Blessings and prosperity."
"Long live the community."

questions.question: Which of these events happened first in the story?

choices.answer: While biking along the road, Jonas and Gabriel saw birds
Father used a syringe to inject liquid into the baby's scalp
The Giver shared a memory of a family opening presents
Jonas took pills each morning as treatment for Stirrings

questions.question: Lily petulantly described why she wanted to be a birthmother.Identify a synonym for petulantly.

choices.answer: irritably
softly
cunningly
plainly

questions.question: Which of these is an opinion rather than a fact from the story?

choices.answer: The female attendant at the annex stood to acknowledge Jonas
It was always better to talk about things that were the same
Mirrors were rare in the community
Jonas's family carried out the ritual of telling of feelings

questions.question: The time following the Ceremony of 11's was "marking time" until age 12. To "mark time" means--

choices.answer: plan
wait
mend
grow

questions.question: What is the main idea of The Giver?

choices.answer: a boy sees the flaws in his society; leaves saving a child
The friendship between two boys becomes strained
A man holds the memories of the community
A structured society is threatened by a citizen

questions.question: When The Giver revealed he had a daughter named Rosemary, most readers probably felt--

choices.answer: angry that he had kept the information secret from Jonas
sad for his pain and guilt about his child's release
happy he would be reunited with his family after training
worried that the burden of The Receiver would be too much
